title.narrative: Cluster Munition and Other Conventional Weapons Survey and Clearance in Quang Binh Province

description.narrative: This project is a continuation of activities conducted under the Base Year through Option Year Two. The goal of this project is to enable socio-economic development and improve community safety within ERW-affected communities in Quang Binh Province, Vietnam by reducing the threat of death and injury from landmines and Unexploded Ordnance (UXO). For this project, the program will deploy one Mine Action Team (MAT) for nine months, and one Multi-Task Team (MTT) and one Community Liaison Team (CLT) for twelve months. Through the deployment of highly-skilled clearance teams and based on sound project management principles focusing on efficiency, effectiveness and quality, MAG will enable the release of 2,796,000m2 of land for productive use, conduct 2,319 EOD spot tasks, 143 village meetings, 143 RE sessions and 167 priority assessments.

sector.narrative: Conflict Prevention and Resolution/Peace and Security
